moves.3... Bc5 4. O-O Nge7 5. c3 Bb6 6. d4 exd: Up to now its all know theory. Now normally Qe7 is played, to avoid what is coming now.
moves.13. Nfe5: The Knight on c6 pins the Queen, so the King side will become very vulnerable.
moves.13... fxe5 14. Nxe5 Qd6 15. Bxc6+: Maybee the move Qf3 was better for white.
moves.15... bxc6 16. Rc1 O-O: White is getting some material back with attack
moves.17. Rxc6 Qb4: The Queen has no good fields anymore
moves.19... Qc4 20. Re6e4: Black needs her Queen so Qb5 was better.
moves.24... Qc2 25. Bh6: You allowed me this "petite comnisaison". If gxh6, then Qe5+ and mate in a couple of moves
moves.25... Qc3 26. Rd4 Rae8 27. Rxe8 Rxe8: Now its over, Queen + Rook + Bischop against Rook ...

opening: Ruy Lopez (C64), classical defence, Zaitsev variation
